tree

Class Tree<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.Tree<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - type of the object of the tree's node value

    public class Tree<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Yupeng Lu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tree(V value, Tree<V>... children)
      Constructs object Tree, by either giving the root value, or giving the root value and its children

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(int index, Tree<V> newChild)
      Adds newChild as the new index-th child of this tree (counting from zero), provided that the resultant tree is valid.
      void addChild(Tree<V> newChild)
      Adds newChild as the new last child of this tree, provided that the resultant tree is valid.
      void addChildren(Tree<V>... children)
      Adds each Tree in children as a new child of this tree node, after any existing children, provided that the resultant tree is valid

      java.util.Iterator<Tree<V>> children()

        public Tree<V> lastChild()
        Returns:
        The last child of this tree (or null if this tree is a leaf).

        public int numberOfChildren()
        Returns:
        The number of (immediate) children of this node.

      • child

        public Tree<V> child(int index)
              throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the child trying to get
        Returns:
        The index-th child of this tree (counting from zero, as with arrays)
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if index is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of children.

      • children

        public java.util.Iterator<Tree<V>> children()
        Returns:
        An iterator for the children of this tree.

      • isLeaf

        public boolean isLeaf()
        Returns:
        False if this node has children.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Compares this tree with given tree to see whether they are equal
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        True if (1) the given object is a Tree, and (2) the value fields of the two trees are equal, and (3) each child of one Tree equals the corresponding child of the other Tree.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A multiline representation of this Tree. Each line contains the toString() representation of the value in that node, terminated with a newline (\n). Each child is indented two spaces under its parent.

        public void addChild(Tree<V> newChild)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds newChild as the new last child of this tree, provided that the resultant tree is valid.
        Parameters:
        newChild - the new tree that is going to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the resultant tree is not valid

      • addChild

        public void addChild(int index,
            Tree<V> newChild)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds newChild as the new index-th child of this tree (counting from zero), provided that the resultant tree is valid.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the newChild
        newChild - the tree that is going to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the resultant tree is not valid

      • addChildren

        @SafeVarargs
public final void addChildren(Tree<V>... children)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds each Tree in children as a new child of this tree node, after any existing children, provided that the resultant tree is valid
        Parameters:
        children - An array of Tree that is going to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the resultant tree is not valid

      • removeChild

        public Tree<V> removeChild(int index)
                    throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Removes and returns the index-th child of this tree, or throws a NoSuchElementException if the index is illegal.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of child want to remove
        Returns:
        The index-th child of the tree
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when index is illegal
